page.title: 09COWLEY HALL
page.content: THE HALL IS IN THE ATTRACTIVE HAMLET OF COWLEY AND STANDS ABOUT HALF A MILE TO THE EAST OF CARTLEDGE HALL.UNTIL RECENTLY THE HALL HAD SOME OF ITS OLD OUTBUILDINGS STILL STANDING BUT IT HAS BEEN ALTERED AND MODERNISED SEVERAL TIMES DURING ITS LONG LIFE,THE FRONT OF THE BUILDING SUGGESTING IT IS EARLY 19TH CENTURY.AT VARIOUS SITES ALONG COWLEY LANE BEFORE ITS STEEP DROP TO THE BROOK ARE VERY OLD FARMHOUSES,THE MAJORITY OF WHICH HAVE BEEN RENOVATED AND RESTORED TO THEIR ORIGINAL STYLE. COWLEY GRANGE FARM STANDS ONLY A SHORT DISTANCE AWAY AND IS ANOTHER FORMER ECCLESIASTICAL GRANGE.
